elements.title: John Rolph
elements.contents: ... that John Rolph (pictured) was arrested while trying to solve Euclid's geometry problems?

elements.title: The Hidden People
elements.contents: ... that The Hidden People by Alison Littlewood is based on the 1895 incident in Ireland where Bridget Cleary was burnt alive by her husband, who believed she was a fairy changeling?

elements.title: Rani Kumudini Devi
elements.contents: ... that Rani Kumudini Devi was the first woman to serve as Mayor of Hyderabad?

elements.title: Jojo Rabbit
elements.contents: ... that Jojo Rabbit director Taika Waititi, a Polynesian Jew, also starred in the film as an imaginary Adolf Hitler?

elements.title: Peter Pernin
elements.contents: ... that Peter Pernin was disciplined by the Catholic diocese of Green Bay for spending too long away publishing his memoir of the Peshtigo fire?

elements.title: KBIF
elements.contents: ... that after losing his job at KBIF when his father was convicted on tax-withholding crimes, future California politician Jim Patterson bought Fresno's KIRV and turned it into a Christian radio station?

elements.title: Hope Muir
elements.contents: ... that Hope Muir was hired as the artistic director of the National Ballet of Canada without any in-person interviews?

elements.title: Big Time Wrestling
elements.contents: ... that Big Time Wrestling featured a wrestling bear that escaped and was subdued after a police hunt by putting sugar in its mouth?
